concept.title: Sound Driver LDD Overview
concept.shortdesc: Describes the sound driver LDD part of the sound driver framework.

section.title: Purpose
section.p: The sound driver provides the conduit by which Symbian platform can access the audio hardware and hence create sounds: for example multi-media applications and ring tones.

section.title: Required background
section.p: Since audio hardware is rather complex, the reader of this document needs to know what is meant by:

dd.p: Stands for COmpressor-DECompressor and refers to the algorithm used to compress and decompress the audio data stream.

section.title: Architecture
section.p: The LDD for the sound driver sits below the RBusLogicalChannel and the RSoundSc classes.
The communication between the driver and the application on the user-side is handled by class RSoundSc.

entry.p: Defines each logical channel. One instance of this class is created for each driver channel opened.

section.title: Typical uses
section.p: The sound driver is used whenever audio operations are required: for example MP3 player, having a phone call and ring tones.
